text:
Here's a short biography of John Lennon:

John Lennon was born on a sunny Tuesday in the bustling city of Liverpool, England in 1942. From a young age, John was fascinated by music and spent hours playing piano and singing in the local church choir. After completing his education, John worked as a delivery boy for a local record store, where he discovered his love for rock and roll music.

In the early 1960s, John teamed up with his friend Paul McCartney to form the Skiffle Kings, a folk-rock band that played in local clubs and bars. After a few years, they added George Harrison and Pete Best to the lineup, and the Beatles were born.

With John's sharp wit, sharp tongue, and sharp nose (he had a distinctive nose shape), he quickly became one of the most beloved and respected members of the band. His songwriting skills shone through on hits like "Imagine" and "Revolution", and his acerbic wit and satirical lyrics in songs like "Give Peace a Chance" and "God" cemented his status as a counterculture icon.

As the Beatles' popularity soared, John became a household name and a leading figure in the 1960s counterculture movement. He was known for his sharp tongue, his love of peace and love, and his love of a good pint of beer.

In the 1970s, John pursued a solo career, releasing critically acclaimed albums like "Plastic Ono Band" and "Sometime in New York City". He was married to the beautiful Yoko Ono, with whom he had a daughter, Sean.

Sadly, John's life was cut short in a tragic accident in 1980, when he was assassinated outside his New York City apartment. But his legacy lives on, and his music remains some of the most beloved and enduring of all time.
